bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from William H. Wranek, Jr., to Philip Showalter Hench, November 6, 1947

div1.p: Wranek hopes that Hench will send him an advance copy of his University of Virginia lecture on Reed. He feels that it will be newsworthy to a Latin American audience.

div1.head: Letter from William H. Wranek, Jr., to Philip Showalter Hench, November 6, 1947
div1.opener:
UNIVERSITY NEWS SERVICE
William H. Wranek, Director
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
Charlottesville, Virginia
November 6, 1947
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Thanks for your long letter about your talk here
November 17. I do hope you can let me have an advance copy or
a few sidelights on what you are going to say. Of course, I do
not expect these to be spectacular news in the usual sense.
If your talk fell into that category, I would not have to bother
about sending it by mail. But I do believe that what you are to
say will have enough general news interest to more than justify
our getting it out and sending it to the Latin American bureaus.
Even though you may have no new facts, the way you will put them
together will certainly have interest and I believe that many
newspaper readers will share the interest that we feel here.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, William H. Wranek, Jr. WHW:wz
